bibl.title: Earnest Hutchinson v. State of Washington. Decree Discharging Petitioner

msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court of the Ninth Circuit
org.placeName: Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: United State Circuit Ninth Cicuit in and for Western Div. of Washington Northern Division
In re Petition of Earest Hutchinson for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington
In the United States Circuit Court of the Ninth Circuit In and For the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Peititon of Earnest Hutchinson for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

This cause coming on to be heard upon the petition of the petitioner, Earnest Hutchinson, and the return of respondent, L. C. Smith, sheriff of King County, State of Washington, to the order of this court issued on the 27th day of July, A.D., 1905, and the petitioner being personally in court and represented herein by his attorneys, Carroll &Carroll, and the respondent, the said sheriff, beingrepresented by Kenneth Mackintosh, prosecuting attorney for said county and state, and the court after hearing arguement on said peition, and the answer thereto, and being fully advised in the premises, the court finds that:

An act making it a misdemeanor to sell or exchange property under the representation, advertisement, notice or inducement that an unidentitifed, unknown, unselected, or chance prize, premium or premium gift, or that a stamp, trading stamp, coupon or other like device, entitling the holder to receive such a prize premium or premium gift, or that the redemption of such a stamp, trading stamp, coupon or other like device, to aid such sale or exchange as aforesaid, and providing a penalty therefor.

Is unconstitutional and void and is in violation of the rights of peitioner secured to him by th 14th Amendment to the Constitution of the United States; that the petiioner's arrest and imprisonment is illegal;
Wherefore it is Ordered, Adjudged and Decreed that the petioner, Earest Hutchinson, be, and he is hereby dischared from custody and restraint, and that said petitioner shall
have and recover from respondent his costs and disbursements herein to be taxed, and that execution may issue thereof.
